0: Google said Monday that its self-driving cars had been involved in 11 “minor” accidents in the past six years, a disclosure the company hopes will assuage concern about the safety of the technology, but may have the opposite effect. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Chris Urmson, head of Google’s self-driving car program, said in a blog post that the accidents caused no injuries and only “light damage.” Google’s cars were not the cause of any of the incidents, he added. He said Google’s cars had driven 1.7 million miles over the period. Google’s damage.” cars million accidents post safety incidents, damage.” caused that
